history.text: Have you ever seen the movie "The Blind Side"

Yes, I have. i thought it was good but I am not much of 
a fan of sad movies.
I am shocked on the rotten tomatoes and metacritic score.  They are both average and then cinema gives it an A+
Sad? I thought it was very uplifting. I loved Sandra Bullock in it.
Uplifting, yes, but still sad.  It's a movie that makes people cry.
And lil S.J. what an awesome roll he had!
Oh I definitely cried, but happy tears!
Is SJ the sibling? I can't remember.
Yes, and I had no idea that Tim McGraw was the father in the movie.
I work for a school though, not  highschool level but its always great seeing movies like this based off true stories knowing people are out there helping others.

I know. I love Tim McGraw and reading this i'm like he was in the movie. It's been a long time since I've seen it so looking over the document is somewhat bringing back my memory but still shocked by some stuff.
I love that it is based on a true story, too!
yeah!
critics loved sandra bullock in it.  I think she did fit the role well
Are you normally a fan of movies involving sports?
Kinda. I like coach carter a lot and friday night lights.
I know I've watched more but they aren't ones that stick with me as much
how about you?
Rudy! Rudy!
Oh, i heard of that one but i don't think i've seen it. I'd like too.
Gosh, I can't believe blind side came out in 2009.  that was almost 10 years ago!!! i feel old.
probably the last time i've seen it too.
One of may favorite values shown in this movie is how Leigh Anne's friends are concerned that this boy is living in her house and she does not take their opinions
oh yes. I remember that.  Good for her!
And when he runs away! oh that got me!
hmm i vaguly remember that scene.  Doesn't she go find him walking down the street in a car?
I am not sure. I know that he had to work really hard to maintain grades good enough to play football.
Yeah, He got to go to college!  Or was accepted at least.  That was huge!
Oh yes and now I remember the tutor, Miss Sue!
Yeah! :)
And he waent to look for his biological mom.
Foster care, addicted mom...tough life
yeah. what a mess. poor kid.  And gangs threathening him.

Leigh and 
Foot ball saved his life in so many ways.
Ooof and when that gangster makes sexual comments about Collins, his sister

uid1response.feedback: I got so caught up with trying to recall the movie and had a hard time pretending that I've just watched the movie.  I litterally wanted to recall a lot of it. sorry.
